sen.j: 藤原 芳子（ふじわら の ほうし/よしこ、生年未詳 - 康保4年7月29日 (旧暦)（967年9月6日））は、村上天皇の女御で、藤原師尹と藤原定方九女との間の娘。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Hoshi (Yoshiko) (Birth year unknown-September 6, 967) was the nyogo (a consort of an emperor) of Emperor Murakami and the daughter of FUJIWARA no Morotada and the ninth daughter of FUJIWARA no Sadakata.

FUJIWARA no Hoshi (Yoshiko) (year of birth unknown - September 11, 967) was the nyogo (consort) of Emperor Murakami and the daughter of FUJIWARA no Morotada and the ninth daughter of FUJIWARA no Sadakata.

sen.e: Since she was granted with the residence of Senyoden, she was called as "Senyoden no Nyogo"(the nyogo of Senyoden).

sen.j: また、『小一条女御』、『大将御息所』とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: In addition, she was called as "Koichijo Nyogo" and "Taisho no miyasudokoto."

sen.j: 子は昌平親王と、永平親王の二人。
sen.e: Her children were Imperial Princes Masahira and Nagahira.

sen.j: 彼女の長子・昌平親王が956年（天暦10年）生まれなので、その年以前には入内していたと思われる。
sen.e: Since her eldest child, Imperial Prince Masahira was born in 956, she probably underwent judai (an Imperial Consort's bridal entry into court) before that year.

sen.e: She was declared with Nyogo Senge in October 958.

sen.j: 宣耀殿女御と呼ばれるようになる。
sen.e: She began to be called as Senyoden no nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court (a consort of an emperor)).

sen.j: 959年（天徳3年）2月に正五位、962年（応和2年）1月に従四位下。
sen.e: She received the ranks of Shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank) in February 959 and Jushinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) in January 962.

sen.j: 類まれなる美貌で、目尻が少し下がりめの、非常に長い黒髪だったという。
sen.e: She had a beauty that far surpassed others and had the corner of her eyes pointing down and a very long black hair.
She had a beauty that far surpassed others and had the corner of her eyes pointing down and very long black hair.
She had a beauty that far surpassed others and had the corner of her eyes pointing a little down and very long black hair.
sen.cmt: 「少し下がりめの」「少し」訳漏れのためa little を追記しました。

sen.j: 『大鏡』には、誇張もあるだろうが、そんな彼女の様子が、「御車に奉りたまひければ、わが身は乗りたまひけれど、御髪のすそは母屋の柱のもとにぞおはしける（お車にお乗りになれば、ご本人は（車に）乗ってらっしゃるのだが、髪の毛のすそはまだ母屋の柱にある）」と記されている。
sen.e: While there were some exaggerations, "Okagami" (the Great Mirror) described her appearance as 'when she climbed into the cart, her body was in the vehicle but the end of her hair was at the pillar of main building.'

While there were some exaggerations, "Okagami" (the Great Mirror) described her appearance as 'when she climbed into the cart, her body was in the vehicle but the end of her hair was at the pillar of the main building.'

sen.j: 村上天皇の寵愛も厚かった。
sen.e: Emperor Murakami gave her deep affection.

sen.j: そのことに関して、中宮の藤原安子が非常に嫉妬し、土器の破片を芳子に向かって投げつけたという記事も『大鏡』に記されている。
sen.e: Anshi FUJIWARA was deeply jealous about this and "Okagami" recorded an episode where she threw a piece of pottery to Hoshi.
Anshi FUJIWARA was deeply jealous about this and "Okagami" recorded an episode where she threw a piece of pottery at Hoshi.

sen.j: また、非常に聡明でもあり、『古今和歌集』二十巻すべて暗記していたという。
sen.e: She was also very intelligent and completely memorized twenty volumes of "Kokin Wakashu" (A Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry).

sen.j: 村上天皇はこの噂を聞き、本当に暗記しているのか、物忌みの日に試験した。
sen.e: Emperor Murakami heard of this rumor and tested her whether she truly memorized on the day of abstinence.
Emperor Murakami heard of this rumor and on the day of abstinence tested whether she had truly memorized it.

sen.j: ところが、芳子はすべて間違えることなく暗記していた、という記事が『枕草子』の二十段に皇后藤原定子が語った話として記されている。
sen.e: Twentieth paragraph of the "Makura no soshi" (the Pillow Book) stated that Empress FUJIWARA no Teishi mentioned that Hoshi memorized it without a mistake.
